On Friday 20 February 2004 13:36, humbugzilla wrote:
> When creating a new =
testcase, JUnit offers to populate the testcase

My JUnit doesn't.
My JUnit=
 just collects my test methods.

> 1. I would like a checkbox which means a=
dd all those testmethods but
> commented out initially. This would save my =
usual next action which is
> to go through manually commenting them out - i=
n some classes, this is
> a lot of work.

Are you sure JUnit does this? I'd=
 suspect your IDE does this.

> 2. I would like to see a checkbox and textf=
ield which would allow me
> to append a suffix to each testmethod. At my pr=
esent stage of using
> JUnit, I find I start out with the test method given=
 me by JUnit
> automagically,  then I populate the body with my test, then =
I
> copy/paste the testmethod, add 001 to the end of the first of them,
> 0=
02 to the end of the second one, and go on to edit the body of the
> second=
 of these testmethods.

Why not just change the name to whatever the test d=
oes, like 
testFooDoesBar or testFooDoesThrowOnBarArg?

If you copy your te=
st code, consider moving the duplicated code to 
setUp().

> 3. It would be=
 great if while viewing an existing testcase file, I

JUnit wizard that lets me add more testmethod(s)

s, even some other, class.

My keyboard is my wizard...
